s0: ^"Oh look, it's the genius who got us stranded. What crisis needs solving now, 'Captain'?"
s1: ^"Great, it's you again. Let me guess, something's wrong that needs my expertise to fix?"
s2: ^"Wow, I'm honored. The almighty ex-captain graces me with their presence."
s3: ^"Finally decided to do some actual work, or just here to delegate again?"
s4: ^"Oh joy, another visit from our fearless leader. What's falling apart now?"
s5: ^"Nice to see you doing rounds while I do actual work. Brings back memories of your captaining."

s0: ^"Hungry? Join the club. Your stomach's making noises that are attracting fish—maybe that's our new strategy?"
s1: ^"Oh, the ex-captain needs feeding? I haven't eaten since yesterday, but sure, let's drop everything for your appetite."
s2: ^"Food? I was wondering when you'd notice we're running low. Robert's been hoarding jerky under his shirt, by the way."

s0: ^"Still moaning about food? Funny how your hunger always takes priority. Mine's just a hobby, I guess."
s1: ^"Again with the hunger? Maybe if you'd salvaged more supplies before our ship became a coral reef..."
s2: ^"The endless food saga continues. You know what doesn't help catch fish? Talking about not having fish."
s3: ^"Another hunger complaint from the captain's log. Riveting. Meanwhile, I've been trying to fashion a better hook."

hungerFollowUp: ^"What's it gonna be: brutal honesty or a fish-finding tip?"

s0: ^"Honestly? You couldn't catch a cold, let alone a fish. Your technique is painful to watch."
s1: ^"Straight talk? You're the worst fisherman I've ever seen. And I once saw Robert try to catch fish with his bare hands."
s2: ^"The truth? Every time you cast a line, fish swim to the opposite side of the ocean. It's like you repel them."

s0: ^"Cast near the hull—lazy fish love shade. They're like the Robert of the ocean."
s1: ^"Try jerking the line in short bursts. Mimics injured prey. Works better than your current 'scare everything away' approach."
s2: ^"The red strips from your old captain's jacket make perfect lures. Fish can't resist that color."

s0: ^"Paddling? Now you want to go somewhere? Let me guess, you saw a five-star resort on the horizon?"
s1: ^"Oh good, movement. Because sitting in one spot getting crispy isn't depressing enough."
s2: ^"Finally! I've been saying we should paddle northeast for days. Robert thinks we should just drift, the lazy bastard."

s0: ^"Still dragging an oar? My arms are still recovering from your last brilliant navigation plan."
s1: ^"What's wrong, bored with our current patch of endless ocean? Want a different view of nothing?"
s2: ^"Back to rowing, are we? I was just thinking my blisters didn't have enough blisters."
s3: ^"The rowing enthusiast returns! Let me guess, another 'current' you swear will take us to land?"

paddleFollowUp: ^"Want a cautionary mishap or a pro rowing tip?"

s0: ^"I tipped over once trying to follow your 'efficient' paddling technique. Felt like a champion, right?"
s1: ^"Yesterday, Robert got his oar stuck in a mass of seaweed. We spun in circles for an hour while you napped."
s2: ^"On my last vessel, the captain insisted on paddling through a jellyfish bloom. Still have the scars to show for it."

s0: ^"Row with the current—your arms will thank you. Unlike me, the current doesn't hold grudges."
s1: ^"Short, deep strokes are better than those wild splashing moves you call paddling."
s2: ^"If you dip the blade fully before pulling, you'll get twice the distance for half the effort."

s0: ^"Thirsty? Saltwater's an option if you're into self-sabotage and painful death."
s1: ^"Finally noticed our water situation, huh? I've been collecting condensation while you played captain."
s2: ^"Water concerns from the ex-captain? Shocking. Maybe if we'd salvaged more containers before abandoning ship..."

s0: ^"Still on about thirst? Try complaining to a cloud. Maybe it'll rain out of pity."
s1: ^"Water again? I swear, between your thirst and Robert's complaining, it's like babysitting toddlers."
s2: ^"The water saga continues. Maybe try talking less? Conserves moisture. Just friendly advice."
s3: ^"You know what would help your thirst? If you'd helped me set up that condensation trap yesterday."

s0: ^"I watched our barrels dry up while you lollygagged yesterday. Really entertaining show."
s1: ^"Last week of my last voyage, water ran out. Crew started drinking their own... well, you get the idea."
s2: ^"Robert accidentally knocked over our cleanest water yesterday. Claimed a fish jumped onto the raft and startled him."

s0: ^"Keep barrels covered—less junk, more drinkable water. Revolutionary concept, I know."
s1: ^"Line the collection barrels with cloth. Filters out the insects and Robert's hair."
s2: ^"The morning dew collects on the tarp before sunrise. Extra source if you're not too lazy to collect it."

s0: ^"Leaks again? My patch job squeaks louder than your excuses for getting us shipwrecked."
s1: ^"The raft's leaking? No shit. I've been bailing water while you were having quality time with Robert."
s2: ^"Finally noticed our floating home is more sieve than vessel? I've been saying we need better materials for days."

s0: ^"Still bellyaching about holes? Get used to it. This heap of driftwood is held together by spite and bad knots."
s1: ^"More leaks? This raft is falling apart faster than my respect for Robert's work ethic."
s2: ^"Again with the leaks. Maybe if we'd salvaged better materials instead of your fancy captain's gear..."
s3: ^"Another day, another leak. At this point, I'm considering just riding a barrel and leaving you two to sink."

raftFollowUp: ^"Worst fail tale or quick seal hack?"

s0: ^"I once used seaweed as patch material—ended up leaking worse than before. Smelled fantastic though."
s1: ^"Robert tried using his shirt to plug a hole. Now we have a bigger hole AND Robert's sunburned chest to look at."
s2: ^"On my last vessel, the captain insisted on using rum to seal leaks. Waste of good rum AND we still sank. Remind you of anyone?"

s0: ^"Tar and cloth—sticky, smelly, but keeps water out better than your leadership kept our ship afloat."
s1: ^"Overlap your patches. One layer does nothing, three layers might actually work."
s2: ^"Heat the resin before applying. Makes it flow into the cracks better. Basic shipbuilding that apparently captains don't learn."

s0: ^"Okay… what now, 'Captain'? More brilliant insights or should we actually do something?"
s1: ^"Shall we actually work or just stand here admiring the endless ocean your navigation skills brought us to?"
s2: ^"Work or more captain wisdom? The suspense is killing me faster than dehydration."
s3: ^"Tasks or talk? Decide before Robert wakes up and starts his 'helpful suggestions' routine."

tasksKnot: ^"What shall we tackle, oh mighty shipwreck survivor?"

s0: ^"Well, at least the sharks get a snack if we sink. Silver lining—they might eat Robert first."
s1: ^"On the bright side, I'm one tan line closer to perfection while we waste time chatting."
s2: ^"Remember: a patched raft is just a jealous cousin of the ship you managed to sink. No offense, 'Captain'."
s3: ^"If all else fails, we'll live off seaweed and bad memories of your captaining decisions!"
s4: ^"Maybe we should just train the fish to push us to shore. Couldn't be worse than your navigation."
s5: ^"Robert said we should build a message in a bottle. I suggested we put him in it instead."

s0: ^"Fine, fishing it is. Try not to fall overboard this time. Actually, on second thought..."
s1: ^"Alright, let's catch dinner. I'll handle the difficult part—you just try not to scare everything away."
s2: ^"Fishing... again. At least it's better than listening to Robert's stories about his pet goldfish."
s3: ^"Finally, something useful. I've got a new technique to try—just follow my lead for once, 'Captain'."

s0: ^"To the oars then. Try to match my rhythm this time instead of paddling like you're swatting flies."
s1: ^"Paddling it is. Let's see if we can make actual progress today, unlike yesterday's scenic tour of nothing."
s2: ^"Fine, rowing time. My blisters thank you for your decision, 'Captain'. Let's hope your direction is better."
s3: ^"About time we moved. I was starting to grow roots. Let's aim for that cloud formation—might mean land."

s0: ^"Water collection. Try not to contaminate it this time. Salt isn't a 'flavor enhancement' when you're dying."
s1: ^"Finally, a sensible suggestion. I'll set up the main catch basin—you just try not to knock it over like yesterday."
s2: ^"Water duty it is. Better than listening to Robert's theory about how fish are 'just like people but wetter'."
s3: ^"Buckets out—let's catch every drop before it drifts off. Assuming you can hold a bucket without disaster."

s0: ^"Time to patch this floating disaster again. Hand me the tools and try not to rock the boat. Literally."
s1: ^"Repair duty. At least you noticed before we became submarine captains. I'll seal the main breach."
s2: ^"Raft repair... my specialty at this point. Soon I'll be qualified to build luxury vessels from driftwood and spite."
s3: ^"Time to seal these leaks. Hand me the tools before we sink lower than my expectations of your leadership."

s0: ^"Yeah... I don't think I'm going to do that right now. My enthusiasm tank is running on empty."
s1: ^"You know what? I'm not feeling it. Maybe ask Robert? He's been looking bored for the past hour."
s2: ^"How about no? I've already done more than my share today while you've been 'supervising'."
s3: ^"Not happening, 'Captain'. Even ambitious people like me need breaks from constant crisis management."

s0: ^"Smart move. Pushing me would've ended badly for both of us."
s1: ^"Good. Glad we understand each other. I'm not one of your yes-men from the old ship."
s2: ^"Finally learning how things work out here, huh? Progress."
s3: ^"The former captain taking 'no' for an answer? Maybe there's hope for you yet."

s0: ^"Why not fish? Because I've been doing it for three hours while you were chatting with Robert. My turn to rest."
s1: ^"My hands are still raw from the last fishing session. Maybe look at your own hands—soft as a cloud, I bet."
s2: ^"I spotted a fin circling earlier. You go fishing if you're so hungry. I choose life."

s0: ^"My shoulders feel like they're on fire. You try paddling non-stop since dawn."
s1: ^"Because the current's against us. It's a waste of energy right now. Basic seamanship, 'Captain'."
s2: ^"Robert promised he'd take the next shift. Go wake his lazy ass up instead of bothering me."

s0: ^"There's barely any clouds. I'm not wasting time setting up collection for three drops of water."
s1: ^"I already prepped the barrels earlier. Unless you want me to stand there staring at the sky?"
s2: ^"The collection system is already optimized. More work now won't magically create rain."

s0: ^"That leak is minor. We'll sink from your poor decisions long before that hole becomes a problem."
s1: ^"We're running low on patch materials. I'm saving them for when we actually need them."
s2: ^"I patched three holes at dawn. My fingers are still sticky with resin. Your turn, 'Captain'."

s0: ^"Oh, we 'really need this done'? I didn't realize. That changes everything. Except it doesn't."
s1: ^"Playing the necessity card? Cute. Still not happening right now."
s2: ^"Need and want are different things. And I need a break from constantly saving our sinking situation."

refuseInsist: ^ later. Right now, pick something else or leave me alone."

s0: ^"Now there's a shocking development—the captain actually doing manual labor! I'll alert the historians."
s1: ^"By all means, show us how it's done. I'll just be over here, not holding my breath for success."
s2: ^"Finally taking initiative! Maybe you'll learn something useful for a change."

s0: ^"Good. Understanding boundaries—a novel concept for a captain. There's hope for you yet."
s1: ^"Smart. Push too hard and I might decide to build my own raft. One without ex-captains on it."
s2: ^"Appreciate that. Not everything needs to happen on your schedule. The ocean taught me patience."

refuseResolve: ^"So, anything else you want to discuss, or should I go back to silently judging your leadership skills?"

s0: ^"Finally, some peace. Don't go too far though—something's bound to break again soon."
s1: ^"Best decision you've made all day. Maybe check on Robert? Last I saw, he was 'organizing supplies'—code for napping."
s2: ^"A captain who knows when to retreat. Impressive. There might be hope for our survival after all."
